isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - 10 SPEED AND 15 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RT, RTO, AND RTX SERIES - REASSEMBLE - MAINSHAFT ASSEMBLY

step1.para: If previously removed, install the corresponding snap rings in the I.D. of the mainshaft gears.
Secure the mainshaft in a vise equipped with brass jaws or wood blocks, pilot end of the shaft down ( Figure 178). If previously removed, install the roll pin in the keyway.

figure.caption: Figure 178. Secure Mainshaft in Vise

step1.para: Install the 4th speed gear limit washer on the mainshaft, flat side of washer up. Rotate washer in the 1st or bottom groove of the mainshaft to align the splines of the washer with those of the mainshaft ( Figure 179). Install the key in the mainshaft keyway to lock the washer in place.

figure.caption: Figure 179. Align Washer Splines With Mainshaft Splines

step1.para: Install the spacer on the shaft against the washer ( Figure 180).

figure.caption: Figure 180. Install Spacer on Shaft

step1.para: Install the 4th speed (or overdrive) gear on the mainshaft, clutching teeth down and engaged with the external splines of the spacer ( Figure 181).

figure.caption: Figure 181. Install 4th Speed Gear on Mainshaft

note.para: Gear limit washers are internally splined and locked to mainshaft by the key. Gear spacers are externally splined to engage with clutching teeth in gear hubs. There is one limit washer and one spacer for each gear in the mainshaft assembly.

step1.para: Setting Correct Axial Clearances for Mainshaft GearsAxial Clearance (End Play) Limits Are: .005 - .012 inch for all mainshaft gears.
Washers are used to obtain the correct limits; six thicknesses are available as follows:

note.para: New style limit washers come in a full range of tolerances as corresponding colors listed above "+ red." (Example: "Orange plus red" limit washer has an inch limit thickness of .258-.260.)

step1.para: Always use the .248-.250 low tolerance washer (White or White plus red) in the 1st, 3rd and reverse speed gear positions as shown in Figure 182.

figure.caption: Figure 182. Always Use Low Tolerance Washer in 1st, 3rd and Reverse Speed Gear Positions

step1.para: On Overdrive models, the 4th speed gear becomes 5th speed.
Install the 3rd speed gear on the shaft against the 4th speed (or overdrive) gear, clutching teeth up ( Figure 183).

figure.caption: Figure 183. Install 3rd Speed Gear on Shaft

step1.para: Install the spacer in 3rd speed gear, engaging the external splines of the spacer with the clutching teeth of the gear ( Figure 184).

figure.caption: Figure 184. Install Spacer in 3rd Speed Gear

step1.para: Remove the key from the keyway and install the 3rd speed gear limit washer on the mainshaft, flat side of the washer down and against the spacer. Rotate the washer in the 2nd groove of the mainshaft to align the splines of the washer with those of the mainshaft and re-insert the key in the keyway to lock the washer in place (inset, Figure 185).

figure.caption: Figure 185. Install 3rd Speed Gear Limit Washer on Mainshaft

step1.para: Insert two large screwdrivers between the 3rd and 4th speed (or overdrive) gears to check axial clearances ( Figure 186). Apply slight downward pressure on screwdriver handles to spread gears evenly. Making sure the gear hubs are parallel, insert a feeler gauge between the hubs. Correct axial clearance should be from .005 to .012 inch. If the clearance is less than the minimum .005 inch tolerance, the limit washer in the 3rd speed gear should be replaced by a thinner limit washer. This will increase the axial clearance between the gears. If the clearance checked is greater than the maximum .012 inch tolerance, a thicker limit washer should be installed in the 3rd speed gear. This would decrease the axial clearance between the gears.

figure.caption: Figure 186. Check Axial Clearances

step1.para: Install the 2nd-3rd speed sliding clutch, aligning the missing internal spline of the sliding clutch with the key in the mainshaft ( Figure 187).

figure.caption: Figure 187. Install 2nd-3rd Speed Sliding Clutch

step1.para: Remove the key from the keyway and install the 2nd speed gear limit washer on the mainshaft, flat side of the washer up. Rotate washer in the 3rd groove of the mainshaft to align the splines of the washer with those of the mainshaft and reinsert key in the keyway to lock the washer in place ( Figure 188).

figure.caption: Figure 188. Re-Insert Key in Keyway to Lock Washer in Place

step1.para: Install the spacer on the shaft against the washer ( Figure 189).

figure.caption: Figure 189. Install Spacer on Shaft

step1.para: Install the 2nd speed gear on the mainshaft, clutching teeth down and engaged with the external splines of the spacer ( Figure 190).

figure.caption: Figure 190. Install 2nd Speed Gear on Mainshaft

step1.para: Install the 1st speed gear on the shaft against the 2nd speed gear, clutching teeth up ( Figure 191).

figure.caption: Figure 191. Install 1st Speed Gear on Shaft

step1.para: Install the spacer in 1st speed gear, engaging the external splines of the spacer with the clutching teeth of the gear ( Figure 192).

figure.caption: Figure 192. Install Spacer in 1st Speed Gear

step1.para: Remove the key from the keyway and install the 1st speed gear limit washer on the mainshaft, flat side of the washer down and against the spacer. Rotate the washer in the 4th groove of the mainshaft to align the splines of the washer with those of the mainshaft and re-insert the key in the keyway to lock the washer in place (inset, Figure 193).

figure.caption: Figure 193. Install 1st Speed Gear Limit Washer on Mainshaft

step1.para: Check axial clearances and make adjustments, if necessary, between the 1st and 2nd speed gears as described in Step 9 of this section ( Figure 194).

figure.caption: Figure 194. Check Axial Clearances

step1.para: Install the 1st-Reverse speed sliding clutch, aligning the missing internal spline of the sliding clutch with the key in the mainshaft ( Figure 195).

figure.caption: Figure 195. Install 1st-Reverse Speed Sliding Clutch

step1.para: Remove the key from the keyway and install the reverse gear limit washer on the mainshaft, flat side of the washer up. Rotate the washer in the 5th groove of the mainshaft to align the splines of the washer with those of the mainshaft and reinsert key in the keyway to lock the washer in place ( Figure 196).

figure.caption: Figure 196. Install Reverse Gear Limit Washer on Mainshaft

step1.para: Install the spacer on the shaft against the washer ( Figure 197).

figure.caption: Figure 197. Install Spacer on Shaft

step1.para: Install the snap ring in the 6th groove of the mainshaft to retain key in the keyway ( Figure 198).

figure.caption: Figure 198. Install Snap Ring in 6th Groove of Mainshaft

step1.para: Install the snap ring in the hub of the reverse gear ONLY TO CHECK AXIAL CLEARANCE (END PLAY) LIMITS ( Figure 199).

figure.caption: Figure 199. Install Snap Ring in Reverse Gear Hub

step1.para: Install the reverse gear on the mainshaft, clutching teeth down and engaged with the external splines of the spacer ( Figure 200).

figure.caption: Figure 200. Install Reverse Gear on Mainshaft

step1.para: Install the auxiliary drive gear assembly in its proper position on the rear of the mainshaft ( Figure 201). Install the auxiliary retaining snap ring in the mainshaft snap ring groove.

figure.caption: Figure 201. Install Auxiliary Drive Gear Assembly

step1.para: Force both the reverse gear and auxiliary drive gear downward on the shaft to flatten their respective snap rings ( Figure 202). Making sure the gear hubs are parallel, insert a feeler gauge between the hubs of the reverse gear and auxiliary drive gear. Correct axial clearance should be from .005 inch to .012 inch. If clearance is less than the minimum .005 inch tolerance, the reverse gear limit washer should be replaced by a thinner limit washer. This will increase the axial clearance between the gears. If the clearance checked is greater than the maximum .012 inch tolerance, a thicker limit washer should be installed in the reverse gear. This would decrease the axial clearance between the gears.

figure.caption: Figure 202. Force Reverse Gear and Auxiliary Drive Gear Downward

note.para: This check is made without spreading the gears with screwdrivers.

step1.para: With the proper reverse gear limit washer installed on the mainshaft, remove the auxiliary drive gear assembly and reverse gear ( Figure 203).

figure.caption: Figure 203. Remove Auxiliary Drive Gear Assembly and Reverse Gear

step1.para: Install the reverse gear on the mainshaft ( Figure 204). Engage the clutching teeth of the gear with the splines of the spacer and sliding clutch and move the reverse gear against the 1st speed gear.

figure.caption: Figure 204. Install Reverse Gear on Mainshaft

note.para: DO NOT REPLACE the reverse gear internal snap ring at this time.

step1.para: Remove the mainshaft assembly from the vise. Align the missing internal spline of the 4th-5th speed sliding clutch with the key in the mainshaft and install on the front of the shaft, engaging the external splines of the sliding clutch with the clutching teeth of the 4th speed (or overdrive) gear ( Figure 205).

figure.caption: Figure 205. Align Spline of 4th-5th Speed Sliding Clutch With Mainshaft Key
